1.verse: Greetings - From: Paul, a prisoner of the Messiah Jesus, and Timothy our brother. To: Philemon our dear friend and fellow worker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.

3.verse: May grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be yours!

4.verse: Paul’s Prayer for Philemon - I always thank my God when I mention you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I keep hearing about your love for all the saints and the faith that you have in the Lord Jesus.

6.verse: I pray that your partnership in the faith may become effective as you fully acknowledge every blessing that is ours in the Messiah.

7.verse: For I have received considerable joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed, brother, through you.

8.verse: Paul’s Plea for Onesimus - For this reason, although in the Messiah I have complete freedom to order you to do what is proper,

9.verse: I prefer to make my appeal on the basis of love. I, Paul, as an old man and now a prisoner of the Messiah Jesus,

10.verse: appeal to you on behalf of my child Onesimus, whose father I have become during my imprisonment.

11.verse: Once he was useless to you, but now he is very useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: As I send him back, it’s like I’m coming along with him.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me so that he could serve me in your place during my imprisonment for the gospel.

14.verse: Yet I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your good deed might not be something forced, but voluntary.

15.verse: Perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while, so that you could have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave but better than a slave—as a dear brother, especially to me, but even more so to you, both as a person and as a believer.

17.verse: So if you consider me a partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: If he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, am writing this with my own hand: I will repay it. (I will not mention to you that you owe me your very life.)

20.verse: Yes, brother, I desire this favor from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Messiah!

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you because I know that you will do even more than I ask.

22.verse: Meanwhile, prepare a guest room for me, too, for I am hoping through your prayers to be returned to you.

23.verse: Greetings from Paul’s Fellow Workers - Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in the Messiah Jesus, sends you greetings,

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.verse: May the grace of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be with your spirit! Amen.
